ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: The usage of various source material in the field of Chinese studies.
Essential knowledge and skills in finding and using primary and secondary source materials for professional research in East Asian Studies, especially Chinese Studies.

This course helped me to establish a full view of bibliographical and primary sources for historical studies on China. From this course, I developed my own bibliography for my own research on Chinese photography and collected a considerable amount of primary sources. All these work by the end of the semester helped me to form a research idea on the relationship between photographic aesthetics and its material conditions.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: This is a great course! I do not think there is anything it needs improvement, it is well structured, well organized, and extremely fun!

The strength of this course is that it helps develop a powerful foundation for doing research. This course is a must for students writing research papers and dissertations. The weakness of this course is that students might need to invest more time in the weekly assignments.

One of the best characteristics of this course is that the students can do their works according to their own needs. This is particularly helpful for students who just entered a new field of research. Also, this course presents the students with ancient paintings, maps, books and scrolls at Beinecke, which is both an ideal way of teaching and a rare opportunity to appreciate the cultural relics in hand. Perhaps the course can give a more thorough introduction on ancient booksFor example, how did ancient Chinese scholars tell that whether a claimed-to-be ancient text was forged or not?

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Yes! I highly recommend this course to anyone who wants to learn and conduct research in Chinese history, it is a very well-rounded and extremely informative and rewarding class.
I strongly recommend this course to other students. This course is essential for developing professional research skills.
Yes. For anyone interested in Chinese history or literature, no matter which time periods, this course can be certainly necessary.
